episode_title: 611 - The One With The Apothecary Table

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, everyone is there as Joey enters happily.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, do you guys think I have a chance with Janine?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, we have been through this before!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Don’t do this to yourself.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She’s made it pretty clear, it is not going to happen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well all right then, I guess I shouldn’t get to excited about the fact (excitedly) that I just kissed her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You serious?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah well, we’ll see.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You kissed her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh we kissed it up real nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you kissed her, so what happened after that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I came over here to tell you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So she’s just waiting over there for ya?
(Joey nods yes, but suddenly realizes what he did and runs out of the apartment and back to his place.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Janine are pretty much making out at one of the tables as Monica and Rachel look on from the couch.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I gotta go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I’m gonna be really late for dance class!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Okay, now I’m really late. (Gets up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, I’m all right, okay, but hey, could you just leave your lips? (She kisses him on the cheek and starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye. (Janine exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Have you kissed her yet? It’s awesome! I could do it forever! Y’know what? She-she kisses better than my mom cooks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am so glad you said cooks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh hey Rachel, sweetheart? You have got to tell the post office that you have moved. Okay? We are still getting all your bills and stuff. (Hands her all of her bills and stuff.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh, Pottery Barn ! (Grabs the aforementioned catalog and holds the rest back out to Chandler.) You can throw the rest away.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not your garbage man. I’m your mailman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica look! Look-look-look! Here is that table that I ordered. (Shows her the picture.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You got it from Pottery Barn ?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! It’s an apothecary table. Does anyone even know what an apothecary is?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A pharmacist. (Rachel mocks him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, Phoebe hates Pottery Barn .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I hate Pottery Barn too. They kicked me out of there just because I sat on a bed!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You took off your pants and climbed under the sheets!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I was tired!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe hates Pottery Barn ?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, she hates all mass produced stuff. She thinks her furniture should have a history, a story behind it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well this has story behind it! I mean they had to ship it all the way from the White Plains store.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s gotta be one of a kind. Y’know like umm, y’know uh, what’s that God awful ceramic fruit bowl she has on her counter?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! I made that for her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You made pottery?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! I made it of this fruit bowl I found in the garbage.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m telling—If you put that in her apartment you’ll never hear the end of it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay fine! I’ll-I’ll just tell her it’s an antique apothecary table, she doesn’t have to know where it came from. Oh! Look at this little drawers! Oh look-look it says that it holds 300 CDs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, just like the apothecary tables of yore…

content.description: The Hallway between the apartments, Joey, Janine, Chandler, and Monica are returning from a double date. Chandler is telling a joke.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …so then the farmer says, “That’s not a cow and you’re not milking it.” (Everyone laughs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am so glad you guys got together, Chandler and I are always looking for a couple to go out with and now we have one!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look at us, we’re a couple of couples!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I had so much fun tonight, and what a great restaurant.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And Chandler I can’t believe I let you pay for this one. (They hug and he whispers in his ear.) Thanks man.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So do you guys gonna come over tomorrow? I’ll make that pasta thing I was telling you about.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Oh that would be great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, but hey look, at least let us bring the wine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, you don’t have too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope-op! I insist! (He hugs Chandler again and whispers to him.) You get the wine right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah all right. (They part.) Okay, good night guys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See ya tomorrow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Tomorrow!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Can’t wait! (They each go into their respective apartments.)
[Cut to Joey and Janine’s.]

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: How are we gonna get out of that one?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I can’t handle two nights in a row with them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What-what’s wrong with Monica and Chandler?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I don’t know, they’re just a little blah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Blah?!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well y’know, he’s blah, she’s just—she’s very loud for such a small person.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, they’re like my best friends. Are you saying we can’t hang out with them? ‘Cause that would kinda be a problem.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: No! Of course we can still hang out with them. Just y’know, not two nights in a row. Okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I guess.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Thank you. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you want, I’ll sell my friends and use the money to buy you presents.

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Rachel is placing CDs into her antique apothecary table as Phoebe returns home.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, what a great table! Where-where did you get it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Guess!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, a flea market?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ha! See, I knew, I knew you’d get it on the first guess. Isn’t it cool! It’s an apothecary table.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Oh you can just imagine that this is where (She’s opening and closing the drawers) they kept all the stuff to make their potions.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know? Ooh, you can almost smell the opium.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Almost.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How much was it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It was only 500 bucks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: 500 bucks at a flea market?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay see I thought, I thought you meant how much was it when it was new, y’know like back then.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah no, I mean it was at a flea market, so it was y’know, it was like a dollar.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A dollar?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And fifty. So it was like one and fifty dollars.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, okay, they gave you the old time pricing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, what period is it from?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, it’s from yore. Like the days of yore. Y’know?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, yes I do. God, oh it’s just perfect! Wow! I bet it has a great story behind it too. Did they tell you anything? Like y’know where it was from or…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! That I know, this is from White Plains.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: White Plains. Oh, it sounds like such a magical place.

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Rachel is entering as Ross comes out of the kitchen carrying popcorn.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! We’re here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! Oh my God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You like it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s my new apothecary table!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! Phoebe’s gonna be here any second, she cannot see this!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well why not?! She’ll-she’ll love it! It’s the real thing! I got it at Pottery Barn .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know you did! I bought the same one! And if she sees your table she’s gonna know that I lied to her. I told her ours was an original.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why did you do that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because she hates Pottery Barn .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She hates Pottery Barn ?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know! I know, she says it’s all mass-produced, nothing is authentic, and everyone winds up having the same stuff. (Ross looks at his table.) So come on, she’s gonna be here any second! Can we please just cover this up with something?! Please?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? No! No! I am not gonna hide it from Phoebe—Ooh, although I did get some great Pottery Barn sheets! (Gets them.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooo! Oh, I forgot they made sheets!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, yeah! I still can’t believe she hates Pottery Barn !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, get over it! It’s not like she hates you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah but Pottery Barn ! Y’know what I think? It’s just she-she’s weird. Y’know it’s because she’s a twin. Twins are weird.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, she’s not weird, she just wants her stuff to be one of a kind.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh. Y’know what’s not one of a kind? A twin!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, Phoebe’s here! Okay, let’s turn out all the lights and we’ll just watch the movie!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Hey—Ooh, cool sheets! (Notices the sheet over the table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you like it? You wanna know where I got it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He got it a flea market!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You bought your sheets at a flea market? Ross come on, you gotta loosen the purse strings a little.

content.description: Joey and Janine’s, Joey is pacing around as Chandler and Monica enter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The dinner will be ready in twenty minutes. This is so exciting.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And here is the bottle of wine for you to bring over tonight. (Hands it to him.) You were also going to buy Monica flowers but you couldn’t afford it, because you paid dinner last night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks. Thanks, but uh actually it’s just gonna be me again tonight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What happened to Janine?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, she’s uh-uh really sick.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s too bad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, she’s been in there all day (Points to her room), uh high fever, a nose problem… Phlegm! Phlegm! Phlegm-phlegm-phlegm!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Monica! Chandler! I’m really-really sorry about tonight. I don’t know if Joey told you; I just couldn’t get out of going to this play. I’m sorry. Have a great time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ‘Kay!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Bye. (Exits)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s funny, I saw no phlegm.

content.description: Joey and Janine’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, she really is sick!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then why-why is she going to a play?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, y’know, starve a fever, go to a play for a cold.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey! Why is Janine not coming over for dinner?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well uh, she didn’t want to hang out with you guys two nights in a row. I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, why does she not want to hang out with us?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because she uh, she-she thinks that you are blah and that you, Monica, are too loud.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!! (Quietly) What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So she was just pretending to have a good time last night? She was lying to our faces?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugh, I can not believe this! I mean, who is she to judge us? We could not have been nicer to her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I am not blah, I am a hoot!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! I know! Come on, please-please you guys, don’t-don’t be mad. I’m sure she just, she just said that stuff because she was nervous and you guys are like my best friends! Y’know? And it was our first date! Plus, she’s really sick!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, you sh—No you said you made that up!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, but don’t you think the sick thing is way better than the play thing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh, they’re both good. I generally just go with, Monica’s drunk again. (Monica glares at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on you guys, come on please-please just give her another chance, huh? She’ll come around I promise.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course we will, come on we gotta make dinner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(They exit and close the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I do not like that woman!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can hear you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am loud!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are watching a movie.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Aww! (They all laugh.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s funny. (Phoebe puts her feet up on Ross’s table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs, could you please not put your feet up on my new…(On Rachel’s glare)…old sheet?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh sure! (She goes to take her feet off, but drags the sheet with her which spills the wine.) Noo!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My apothecary table!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noooooo!! (Phoebe lifts up the sheet to discover the exact same apothecary table they have.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, where did you get this?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I got it at Pottery Barn !! Okay?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, Phoebe, Pottery Barn has ripped off the design of our antique!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Oh my God, well if they’ve ripped off our table ours must be much more than one and fifty dollars!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well this doesn’t even smell like opium.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course not, it smells like wine, which you spilled! And thanks for wrecking my sheet by the way.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Ross, calm down, I’ll give you the 80 cents. (Ross glares at Rachel)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Chandler are sitting at the kitchen table.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, one more time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, would you like some more orange juice?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Perfect decibel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So uh, what are you guys doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh nothing, we’re just talking. Y’know, blah-blah-blah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, come on you guys, you said you were gonna try! All right look, I came over here to invite you guys to a movie with me and Janine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I’d like to but, (extremely quietly) I’m not sure we have time to go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ha-ha, very funny—Look! I don’t know what to do! I really want you guys to get along. Just please come to the movie with us. I mean you owe me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We owe you?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right! I helped you guys out a lot in the start of your relationship. Huh? I helped you guys sneak around for like six months, and I looked like an idiot! And I was humiliated. And I only made 200 dollars!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We didn’t give you any money! (Chandler is motioning, “No!”)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t think I know that!

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Rachel is showing Ross around the newly decorated living room.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …see I can’t decide whether it would go better next to the new wicker dining chair, the Sahara desk, or the Parker console table.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! I didn’t know that there was a Pottery Barn up here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I know. I went a little crazy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A little? Your place looks like page 72 of the catalogue. Oh look at that! The ornamental bird cage! Large!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Ross no. Be careful, that is very old! Okay? Early Colonial bird merchants used to bring their birds to market in that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fascinating.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Another amazing find! Wow! Oh I bet this has a great story too!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh it does, it does! It is a room separating apparatus from Colonial times.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm, a lot of this stuff is from Colonial times. Hey, what are some other time periods Rachel? (She glares at him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well there’s yore. And uh, y’know, yesteryear.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah no, I’m telling you Rachel has such a great eye for this stuff. Ross, y’know if you ever decide you need to redecorate—And I think that you should. You should, you should ask Rachel to help.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey he doesn’t need my help.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, come on! I think he’s ready to get rid of, what did you call it? The cheap knock-offs and dinosaur junk.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?! (To Rachel) Hey, y’know what? Since you have such a great sense of what I need, uh ooh, here’s-here’s 60 bucks, why don’t you take Phoebe down to that Colonial flea market of yours and get me some stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what? I don’t, I don’t think Phoebe really wants to come.
content.parenthetical: not sure of what to do

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! I do want to!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, she does want to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She does want to.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.description: The Street, Phoebe and Rachel are heading back from that Colonial flea market.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, I don’t know what to say. I guess the flea market was just better last time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well at least I got these sheets for Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.
(They walk by a Pottery Barn window display.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uck, look at this! Pottery Barn , yuck!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, y’know what? Don’t look at it. (Realizes the display is their living room) Seriously, don’t look at it. (Tries to pull Phoebe away.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Look-look! There’s the coffee table they stole from us!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, those bastards! Let’s go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That fan kinda looks like ours. And the birdcage and the…wait a sec! This is our exact living room!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No! No! No it’s not! No it’s not! Come on! Phoebe, ours is totally different! I mean we don’t have the… (Looks desperately for something different.) We don’t have the…that lamp! And-and that screen is y’know, on the other side.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God. This is where you got all our stuff, Pottery Barn ! Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! Okay-okay look—no I did, I just wanted this stuff and I know how you feel about Pottery Barn . Just… Come on don’t be mad.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no-no, but I am mad! I am mad! Because this stuff is everything that is wrong with the world! And it’s all sitting up in my living room and all I can think about is how I don’t have that lamp!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well then honey, buy the lamp! Hey, we have that 60 bucks from Ross.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t! I can’t! Unless… Well are you saying that-that you would move out if-if I didn’t buy that lamp?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! No! I’m not gonna move out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But are you saying that you would move out if I didn’t buy that lamp?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Yes! I would so move out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay then I don’t have a choice! I have to buy that lamp!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s right!
(They start to go inside.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But at least the apothecary table is real.

content.description: The hallway, Joey, Janine, Monica, and Chandler are returning from their second date.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, this-this-this was great. Didn’t everybody have a great time?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well I did. I really did. And you guys, I’ve got to say, I’m sorry if I was a little weird after the last time we went out. I guess I was just nervous or something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s totally understandable.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t worry about it.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: So we can go out again?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Absolutely!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Oh good.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well then, good night!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good night! (They go into their respective apartments.)
[Cut to Joey and Janine’s, they’re entering.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See? Eh, wasn’t that fun?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: We have got to move!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I knew it!! Y’know, you’re not so quiet yourself, missy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I’m blah? Listen, the only thing more boring than watching modern dance is having to listen to you talk about it, (Imitating her) “Oh Chandler, I just lost myself in the moment.”

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Y’know, I know you’re talking, but all I hear is, “Blah. Blah. Blah-blah-blah.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right! You and me! Let’s go! Right now!
content.parenthetical: steps up and points at her

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! All right! Enough! Enough! Enough!! Enough! (To Chandler and Monica) You two go home! I-I-I gotta talk to Janine! (They start to leave.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know I think you can take her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’d better hope I don’t see you in the hallway!! (They exit.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, uh, we’ve got a little bit of a problem here. These people are my friends; you can’t treat them that way.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: They said stuff to me too, y’know!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! I know! And I’m going to talk to them about it. They mean so much to me. They… They’re like my family. If you guys are gonna be fighting all the time, I-I… I don’t think we can be together. It just, it just can’t work. It can’t. (Starts to break up) I’m very upset.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Okay. Okay. Would, would it help if I went over and apologized?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah! That would be very helpful! Yeah. (He opens the door for her and she exits into the hallway.)
[Cut to the hallway, Janine is entering as Monica is taking out the garbage.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What did I tell you about the hall?!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I was just coming over here to apologize for my behavior! I’d really like it if we could be friends.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I know that would make Joey happy, so, I would like that too.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now come on. (They hug like men.) Well, I’m glad we worked things out.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I’ll see you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye. (Leaves to resume her garbage removal task.)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Or I’ll hear you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s it big girl! (Hits Janine in the butt with the garbage bag) Come on!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Wait! (Janine pauses, then runs down the stairs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’d better run!
(Joey and Chandler both come into the hallway.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did you hear that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah uh, what am I gonna do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m sorry man. (Pause) You wanna go watch?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! (They head downstairs.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross, Chandler, and Monica are there as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How ya doin’?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey so, did uh, did she move out?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pretty much, yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I cannot believe you broke up with her just like that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, when it’s not right, you know it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah. I’ll be all right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what would cheer you up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m giving this lecture on erosion theories tomorrow night, I think you should come.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re right! That did cheer me up!
